ai-ja253:1.1_0: “For me (there will be) rich drink and food aplenty
ai-ja253:1.2_0: And they appear because of this gem.
ai-ja253:1.3_0: I won’t give it to you—you ask too much,
ai-ja253:1.4_0: Nor will I return to your hermitage.
ai-ja253:2.1_0: Like a youth with a clean sword in his hand,
ai-ja253:2.2_0: after asking me for my gem,
ai-ja253:2.3_0: I won’t give it to you—you ask too much,
ai-ja253:2.4_0: Nor will I return to your hermitage.”
ai-ja253:3.1_0: “One shouldn’t beg from those one wishes to be dear to;
ai-ja253:3.2_0: For begging too much is disagreeable.
ai-ja253:3.3_0: The brāhmaṇa begged for the dragon’s jewel,
ai-ja253:3.4_0: I left and was never to see.”
